apportionment.translation[0].definitions: when something is divided and shared out, or an amount of something that has been divided and shared out
the apportionment of financial support to those states worst affected by the crisis
when each expense is placed in its proper account, or the amount placed in each account
when insurance companies or their clients agree to share the cost of something that goes wrong, or the amount that each person or company agrees to pay
The excess shall be deducted prior to apportionment between the two insurers.
when the buyer and seller of a property agree to share the cost of a bill, for example property tax, that is paid to cover a period during which they will each be owners for a time
You should stipulate the apportionment of any service charge liability in the sale agreement.
